item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (368 points | 36 comments)
2. Dumping Memory to Bypass BitLocker on Windows 11 (46 points | 22 comments)
3. Execution units are often pipelined (119 points | 42 comments)
4. Curl-Impersonate (313 points | 70 comments)
5. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (30 points | 2 comments)
6. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (99 points | 62 comments)
7. Beyond BLE: Cracking Open the Black-Box of RF Microcontrollers [video] (75 points | 9 comments)
8. US credit card defaults jump to highest level since 2010 (35 points | 11 comments)
9. A simple way to explore data through a Tableau-like UI directly in your data app (63 points | 3 comments)
10. From Pegasus to Predator – The evolution of commercial spyware on iOS [video] (354 points | 126 comments)
11. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (139 points | 41 comments)
12. 'Obelisks': New Class of Life Has Been Found in Human Digestive System (196 points | 72 comments)
13. What I Learned Reporting in Cities That Take Belongings from Homeless People (30 points | 4 comments)
14. Ts_zip: Text Compression Using Large Language Models (59 points | 19 comments)
15. YouTuber won DMCA fight with fake Nintendo lawyer by detecting spoofed email (146 points | 58 comments)
16. Empirical Study of Test Generation with LLM's (22 points | 5 comments)
17. Fun facts about SQLite (201 points | 84 comments)
18. Apple M5 could ditch unified memory architecture for split CPU and GPU designs (22 points | 9 comments)
19. Floridians have no right to bodies of water 'free of pollution,' court rules (78 points | 52 comments)
20. Where is James Bond? Trapped in an ugly stalemate with Amazon (51 points | 66 comments)
21. Pincites (YC S23) is hiring a founding engineer to build legal AI agents (Remote) ( | hide)
22. High-Speed Sequential DNA Computing Using a Solid-State DNA Origami Register (4 points | discuss)
23. Show HN: I built open source file sharing solution using AWS S3 (38 points | 20 comments)
24. FTC orders 'gun detection' tech maker Evolv to stop overstating effectiveness (112 points | 101 comments)
25. Bench to be acquired after abruptly shutting down (76 points | 55 comments)
26. What is it like to be a thermostat? (1996) (46 points | 64 comments)
27. Dungeons and Dragons rolls the dice with new rules about identity (24 points | 55 comments)
28. Passkey technology is elegant, but it's most definitely not usable security (233 points | 241 comments)
29. AI companies cause most of traffic on forums (354 points | 240 comments)
30. Limits to Growth (1972) (86 points | 60 comments)
